content: this pair was knit with koigu this pattern is a highly modified fingerless glove pattern i found the original in a magazine i have long forgotten which one and adapted changed and modified this pattern to suit my needs this pattern has become my go-to fingerless gloves pattern i have done it in various sock yarns and fingering yarns and this pattern always comes out great i hope you enjoy knitting these as much as i do if you have any questions please feel free to contact me my user name on ravelry is milkmaidgoddess  sock weight yarn about 191 yard or 50gram  size 1 needles-or those that meet gauge  gauge 16 stitches=2 inches special instructions/abbreviations m1 make 1 increase by picking up the loop between the 2stitches and twist that stitch before you place it on the needle to knit to prevent holes copyright donna m kimball october 2013 milkmaidgoddess pattern stitch k3 p2 rib multiple of 5 stitches wristers cast on 60 stitches placing 15 stitches on each of 4 needles join without twisting and work in k3 p2 rib until cuff measures 3 inches from beginning begin thumb gusset round 1 k1 m1 k1 twice place marker continue in established pattern to end of the row round 2 working thumb gusset stitches as knit stitches continue in established rib pattern to end of round round 3 k1 m1 knit to 1 stitch before the marker m1 k1 continue in in established pattern to end of round repeat rnds 2 and 3 until there are 23 stitches between the beginning of round and marker place 23 gusset stitches on scrap yarn cast on 3 stitches to fill the gap continue working in k3 p2 rib for 2 inches from top of thumb gusset bind off in pattern thumb place stitches from holder onto 2 needles pick up ad knit 4 stitches from the gap for a total of 26 stitches rearrange stitches as needed attach yarn and knit 1 round on next round knit around and decrease 1 stitch at inner thumb-knit 3 rounds even work in k3 p2 rib for 5 rounds bind off in pattern copyright donna m kimball october 2013 milkmaidgoddess you may add length to the wrist hand thumb part as you need just try on see if the length suits you and knit more or less as you need these mitts could very easily be adapted for children as well as adults the rib makes them nice and snug fitting this pair was knit with schachenmayr nomotta crazy cotton copyright donna m kimball october 2013 milkmaidgoddess
